# CGGlyph

**Type Alias**

An index into the internal glyph table of a font.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias CGGlyph = CGFontIndex
```

## Discussion

When drawing text, you typically specify a sequence of characters. However, Core Graphics also allows you to use [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGGlyph] values to specify glyphs. In either case, Core Graphics renders the text using font data provided by the Apple Type Services (ATS) framework.

You provide [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGGlyph] values to the functions [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGContext/showGlyphs(g:count:)] and [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGContext/showGlyphsAtPoint(x:y:glyphs:count:)]. These functions display an array of glyphs at the current text position or at a position you specify, respectively.

## Working with Glyphs

- **numberOfGlyphs**: Returns the number of glyphs in a font.
- **name(for:)**: Returns the glyph name of the specified glyph in the specified font.
- **getGlyphWithGlyphName(name:)**: Returns the glyph for the glyph name associated with the specified font object.
- **getGlyphBBoxes(glyphs:count:bboxes:)**: Get the bounding box of each glyph in an array.
- **getGlyphAdvances(glyphs:count:advances:)**: Gets the advance width of each glyph in the provided array.
- **kCGGlyphMax**: The maximum allowed value of a [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGGlyph].
- **CGFontIndex**: An index into a font table.
- **kCGFontIndexMax**: The maximum allowed value of a [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGFontIndex].
- **kCGFontIndexInvalid**: An invalid font index (a value which never represents a valid glyph).
